instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 no trackpad
threads.message:
820-2936 had minor water damage. Replaced U7200, J5800, and  U4510. Turns on and recognizes keyboard and clicking works on trackpad but trackpad itself does not track. Tried known good track pad and cable

18V on R5806

What to try next? Can U5701 still be to blame even though clicking and keyboard work?

threads.title: 820-2936 no trackpad
threads.message:
Check SMC_LID and BUTTON_DISABLE signals.
Also check continuity between J5800 and U5701.
If all good, change U5701.
